inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of asthma (NIH 2007) for at least 6 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Male or Eligible female (females of child-bearing potential must use acceptable method of birth control)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A best AM pre-bronchodilator FEV1 of 60% to 85% of predicted normal value at Screening
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Reversibility of disease demonstrated by at least 12% and 200mL increase in FEV1
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects must have been prescribed a non-corticosteroid controller at least 3 months preceding Visit 1, and/or a short-acting beta 2 agonist, without the use of inhaled corticosteroids in the 4 weeks prior to Visit 1
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects must be able to replace their current short-acting Beta-2-agonist with albuterol/salbutamol aerosol inhaler for the duration of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects must be judged capable of withholding albuterol/salbutamol for at least 4 hours prior to study visits
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Respiratory infection within expected to affect subject's ability to participate
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Current smoker or smoking history of 10 pack years or more
exclusion.label: met

notes: 39-year-old man with cough and shortness of breath, history of asthma for 3 years. Currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg.
